references.paper_title: Optimal control and viscosity solutions of Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equations, volume 12
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational mathematical framework for optimal control theory, which is central to the theoretical underpinnings of the proposed learning algorithm.
This work offers a comprehensive overview of dynamic programming, a key technique used in solving the optimal control problem that forms the basis of the proposed learning approach.

references.paper_title: Cognitive action laws: The case of visual features
references.reason: This paper introduces the Cognitive Action Principle, which inspires the pre-algorithmic framework for learning proposed in the current research.

This work introduces Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODEs), a novel approach to neural network modeling that is closely related to the continuous-time learning framework proposed in this paper.
This paper provides a comprehensive treatment of partial differential equations, which are essential to understanding and analyzing the continuous-time learning dynamics proposed in the paper.
